channel.title: How to sleep standing up?
channel.description:
First of all, is it even possible to stand up while sleeping for some hours? If yes, what is the best way to keep balance, that might be a problem?
Why I ask? Because I need it to a little competition about patience, and a free "iPhone 4G" is tempting

item.title: How to sleep standing up?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Second you fall asleep your legs will collapse. Same thing happens if you hold your head up with your arm while you try to sleep. http://www.wisegeek.com/is-it-possible-to-sleep-standing-up.htm Also explains why people think they fall asleep while doing physical activities.

item.title: How to sleep standing up?

[quote=“cooper, post:12, topic:369362”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=465497.msg3408654#msg3408654 date=1290507567]

Unsure, i know from personal experience that i’ve fallen asleep while actively using a bicycle on a highway in the middle of the night during mid-summer. I guess that could count as halfway there.
[/quote]This happened to me when I was really high one night, almost got hit by an SUV going like 90… and it was like 3AM.

How the hell do you do that?! The worst that happened to me was I fell asleep while driving, I ended up going 50 on the curb and had to swerve back on the road narrowly avoiding a large tree. Luckily I was the only car on the road so no one could have gotten hurt, though. I can understand falling asleep driving, but falling asleep on a bike? Wow…[/quote]You have to be really really really REALLY tired, and it is vital that you were drunk just a few hours ago so you are in the early stages of the upcoming hangover. I have never been that tired in my entire life
